author: Xinhua
title: UN chief commends peacekeeping mission in Mali as it ends-Xinhua
text:
UNITED NATIONS, Dec. 30 (Xinhua) -- UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Saturday expressed his deep appreciation for the UN peacekeeping mission in Mali as it completed its withdrawal from the country.
The UN chief underscored the pivotal role the UN Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) played in bolstering the peace process.
The mission was instrumental in ensuring respect for the ceasefire under the 2015 Peace and Reconciliation Agreement, as well as in supporting the transition towards the "restoration of state authority," Guterres said.
The secretary-general expressed his "deepest gratitude" towards the personnel of MINUSMA. The mission's head El-Ghassim Wane was particularly commended for his "outstanding leadership in a challenging context."
Regarding the human cost of the mission, the secretary-general paid a poignant tribute to the 311 MINUSMA personnel who lost their lives and the over 700 who were injured.
"The entire United Nations family stands in sympathy and solidarity with the loved ones, friends, and colleagues of the fallen staff," he said, honoring their "selfless devotion to the cause of peace."
With the onset of the liquidation period on Jan. 1, 2024, a smaller team will oversee the transportation of assets and the disposal of United Nations equipment in Mali. Guterres has placed his trust in the "full cooperation of the transitional government" to facilitate the effort.
Reaffirming the United Nations' unwavering support to Mali, the UN chief pledged to continue working with the Malian people towards restoring its constitutional order and promoting peace, security, and sustainable development.
The Security Council on June 30 adopted resolution 2690 to end MINUSMA's mandate as of June 30. It requested the mission to immediately start on July 1 the cessation of its operations, transfer of its tasks, as well as the orderly and safe withdrawal of its personnel, with the objective of completing this process by Dec. 31, 2023.
MINUSMA, established by Security Council resolution 2100 in April, aims to support political processes in Mali by carrying out security-related tasks. â–

author: Harsha Borah
title: Heavy snowfall hits Whitehorse, Canada
text:
Yukonâ€™s capital, Whitehorse, received an unexpected and substantial snowfall, with accumulations ranging from 15 to 20 cm (6 to 8 inches), which began on October 30, following a series of large snowfalls earlier that month.
Residents cleared driveways and sidewalks in response to the heavy snowfall, while city transportation staff sanded and plowed roadways.
On October 30, Wednesday morning, nearly all of Whitehorseâ€™s 44 school buses were in operation, except for three that couldnâ€™t leave their parking areas due to heavy snowfall. Despite delays, all students arrived safely.
Surrounding towns, including Carmacks and different highways across the territory, also experienced severe snowfall, prompting travel advisories due to hazardous driving conditions.
By Wednesday afternoon, the snowfall had eased, and Environment Canada lifted the snowfall warning initially issued on Tuesday.
To this October 30 2024 at 6 am in Whitehorse Yukon pic.twitter.com/KXQk04TV8I
â€” Windy101ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¦ðŸ¾ðŸ¾ðŸ¾ (@hey_butter) October 30, 2024 Winter Storm Warning for Whitehorse Yukon #ytstorm pic.twitter.com/rxJx7IhJnQ
â€” Brandon Houck âš¡ï¸ (@HouckisPokisewx) October 29, 2024 â€œWeâ€™re still gathering the data at this moment, but I would be surprised if there werenâ€™t any records broken,â€ said Ken Dosanjh, a meteorologist with Environment and Climate Change Canada.
â€œ15 cm (6 inches) in Whitehorse, up to 20 cm (8 inches) in Carmacks â€” so definitely a notable event for sure, especially, you know, as we still havenâ€™t even hit November.â€
The current weather patterns in the Yukon are attributed to a low-pressure system, which has brought moist air, leading to heavy snowfall.
While October snow is not unusual in Yukon, the volume and frequency of snowfall this year are unexpected and may set new records for the month.
Bobbie Milnes, the territoryâ€™s director of transportation maintenance, said, â€œI think we were prepared. We had trucks ready in all of our areas, and we did hit our goals in terms of season readiness,â€ he said.
â€œWe work until the work is done. So the main focus is keeping the roads clear and safe for the public.â€
The cityâ€™s response involved deploying all available resources to clear roads and maintain safety for residents, while the transportation department emphasized the importance of being prepared for winter conditions.
â€œIâ€™d say weâ€™re past the brunt of it,â€ Dosanjh said. â€œIâ€™m not seeing too many large-scale events, at least for the next week.â€
Local officials continue to monitor conditions, urging caution for drivers and residents as they adapt to the ongoing winter challenges.
References:
1 Zero visibility reported on some Yukon highways amid heavy snowfall â€“ Yukon News â€“ October 30, 2024
2 Whitehorse digs out after another heavy dump of October snow â€“ CBC â€“ October 31, 2024

author: Editorial ABC
title: Editorial ABC: Otro fraude a la ConstituciÃ³n
text: Los socios del PSOE reclamaban a Pedro SÃ¡nchez que pasara Â«de las palabras al BOEÂ». Tal demanda podrÃ­a dar a entender que el Gobierno socialista no ha utilizado el BoletÃ­n Oficial del Estado para respaldar sus pactos con los nacionalistas o dar carta legal a sus agendas partidistas. AhÃ­ estÃ¡n, para el recuerdo, las leyes de la anterior legislatura del \u0027solo sÃ­ es sÃ­\u0027, la de supresiÃ³n del delito de sediciÃ³n, la modificaciÃ³n de la malversaciÃ³n o la mutilaciÃ³n de competencias del Consejo General del Poder Judicial. Y tambiÃ©n, por supuesto, los innumerables reales decretos-leyes con los que el PSOE ha subvertido el reparto constitucional de funciones entre el poder ejecutivo y el legislativo.Lejos de moderarse en el abuso de la trampa para legislar, el PSOE se ha esmerado con dos nuevo ejemplos. Por un lado, ha despojado al Senado de su veto al techo de gasto pÃºblico pretendido por el Gobierno. Esta expropiaciÃ³n de competencias no se ha hecho mediante reforma especÃ­fica de la Ley OrgÃ¡nica de Estabilidad Presupuestaria y Sostenibilidad Financiera, sino mediante una enmienda intrusa incrustada en el proyecto de la llamada ley de paridad. Aparte de exhibir un fraude a la ConstituciÃ³n con esta forma de legislar, el Ejecutivo y sus socios se jactan de arrasar con lo poco que queda del juego de equilibrios y contrapesos. Por otro lado, SÃ¡nchez ha cumplido su pacto con los nacionalistas de Junts y ha eliminado una reforma de la ley de Enjuiciamiento Civil que, desde marzo pasado, regulaba el \u0027efecto dominÃ³\u0027 de las cuestiones prejudiciales ante el Tribunal de Justicia de la UniÃ³n Europea. El precepto â€“el artÃ­culo 43 bisâ€“ ha sido suprimido mediante un real decreto-ley de medidas anticrisis, otra trampa a la ConstituciÃ³n. Se limitaba a regular lo que hacÃ­an y seguirÃ¡n haciendo los tribunales espaÃ±oles: suspender aquellos procesos que puedan verse afectados por una misma cuestiÃ³n prejudicial planteada ante el TJUE. La peregrina idea de los nacionalistas es que ese artÃ­culo 43 bis iba a expandir los efectos de una prejudicialidad europea sobre la amnistÃ­a planteada por el Tribunal Supremo. La mala noticia para ellos es que, sin dicho precepto, tambiÃ©n podrÃ¡ seguir pasando lo mismo. Lo importante para el Gobierno y su socio nacionalista es hacerse trampas en el solitario. No han aprendido nada de la ley del \u0027solo sÃ­ es sÃ­\u0027, ni de la fallida rebaja de la malversaciÃ³n. El PSOE solo demuestra debilidad y un uso arbitrario del argumento europeo, porque, segÃºn el ministro BolaÃ±os, la reforma de 2023 de la ley de Enjuiciamiento Civil era una exigencia de la ComisiÃ³n Europea, como las modificaciones de la sediciÃ³n y de la malversaciÃ³n. Ha quedado claro que la invocaciÃ³n de la UniÃ³n Europea era una farsa.AdemÃ¡s, si la Sala Segunda del Tribunal Supremo inaplica a los condenados del 1-O la amnistÃ­a por el delito de malversaciÃ³n, sin acudir a la cuestiÃ³n prejudicial europea, esta enÃ©sima cesiÃ³n a los nacionalistas serÃ¡ papel mojado, y no evitarÃ¡ que, en cualquier momento posterior, el Alto Tribunal plantee esa cuestiÃ³n prejudicial.El problema para el Estado constitucional es la impunidad con la que se saldan estas vÃ­as de hecho a las que acude el Gobierno socialista para usar la ley, el Parlamento y el BOE a su conveniencia. Cualquier impugnaciÃ³n ante el Tribunal Constitucional estÃ¡ condenada a un lento proceso de decisiÃ³n, salvo que al Gobierno de Pedro SÃ¡nchez le interese otra cosa.

author: Quotidiano Nazionale
title: Maltempo: in arrivo rovesci e temporali al Sud
text: Un sistema perturbato sta raggiungendo le regioni peninsulari dellâ€™Italia apportando precipitazioni sparse anche temporalesche specialmente in area tirrenica. Tra la sera di oggi e la giornata di domani, Ã¨ attesa una fase di spiccata instabilitÃ  in particolare sulla Campania, in estensione ai settori tirrenici di Basilicata e Calabria settentrionale. Sulla base delle previsioni disponibili, il Dipartimento della Protezione Civile dâ€™intesa con le regioni coinvolte â€“ alle quali spetta lâ€™attivazione dei sistemi di protezione civile nei territori interessati â€“ ha emesso un avviso di condizioni meteorologiche avverse. In dettaglio, dalla serata di oggi si prevedono precipitazioni sparse, anche a carattere di rovescio o temporale, sulla Campania, in estensione dalle prime ore di domani, sabato 14 dicembre, ai settori tirrenici di Basilicata e Calabria settentrionale. I fenomeni saranno accompagnati da rovesci di forte intensitÃ , frequente attivitÃ  elettrica e forti raffiche di vento. Sulla base dei fenomeni previsti e in atto Ã¨ stata valutata per la giornata di domani, sabato 14 dicembre, allerta gialla su Umbria, Lazio, Puglia e settori di Campania, Basilicata e Calabria.

author: @wymt
title: FIRST ALERT WEATHER DAY: Wintry Mix Chance This Evening
text:
FIRST ALERT WEATHER DAY: Wintry Mix Chance This Evening
We had a cloudy and dreary Wednesday throughout Eastern Kentucky.
As of 5 PM, some places picked up as little as .10â€³ of rain, while others, especially near Harlan, picked up .71â€³ of rain.
We will keep the chance of rain in the forecast this evening.
It will transition to snow as we roll into the overnight hours and into the morning hours of your Thursday.
Once this system pushes through in the late morning hours, we will see the clouds decrease, which will leave us with plenty of sunshine.
Then we head into Friday and the weekend where another round of rain will swing through Friday Night and into the day on Saturday.
We will get a break in the afternoon hours and another round swings in Saturday night and Sunday Morning.
Highs this weekend will be in the upper 40s and low 50s.
We will clear out and warm up for the start of next week with lots of sunshine and highs in the low 60s for Monday and upper 60s and even low 70s by next Tuesday and Wednesday.
Enjoy your evening.
Tonight: Chance of Wintry Mix. Wind: W 10-15.
LOW: 31
Tomorrow: AM Chance of Wintry Mix. Mostly Sunny. Wind: W 10-15.
HIGH: 44
Tom. Night: Partly Cloudy. Wind: WSW 5-10.
LOW: 30
Friday: PM Slight Chance of Showers. Partly Cloudy. Wind: SSE 5-10.
HIGH: 57 LOW: 41
Saturday: AM Chance of Showers. Mostly Sunny.
HIGH: 50 LOW: 33
Sunday: Mostly Sunny.
HIGH: 54 LOW: 33
Monday: Sunny.
HIGH: 62 LOW: 40
Tuesday: Sunny.
HIGH: 70 LOW: 45
Wednesday: Sunny.
HIGH: 72 LOW: 54
